intro: Scoparia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican scoparia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, featuring narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Scoparia mexicana is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
